greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations of [n] with exactly k (possibly overlapping) occurrences of the consecutive step pattern up, down, up, down; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=max(0,floor((n-3)/2)), read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..170, flattened
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t) option remember; `if`(u+o=0, 1, expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n, 0, 1)):
mathematica: b[u_, o_, t_] := b[u, o, t] = If[u+o == 0, 1, Expand[Sum[b[u-j, o+j-1, {1, 3, 1, 3}[[t]]]*If[t == 4, x, 1], {j, 1, u}] + Sum[b[u+j-1, o-j, {2, 2, 4, 2}[[t]]], {j, 1, o}]]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, 0, 1]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 15}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 24 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 30 2013
